Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Capability \Ca`pa*bil"i*ty\, n.; pl. {Capabilities}. 1. The quality of being capable; capacity; capableness; esp. intellectual power or ability. [1913 Webster]
A capability to take a thousand views of a subject. --H. Taylor. [1913 Webster]
2. Capacity of being used or improved. [1913 Webster]
